Member Function Documentation

void gaia::service::KeyguardManager::disableKeyguard ( )

Disable the keyguard from showing.

If the keyguard is currently showing, hide it. The keyguard will be prevented from showing again until reenableKeyguard() is called.

A good place to call this is from android.app.Activity#onResume()

Note: This call has no effect while any android.app.admin.DevicePolicyManager is enabled that requires a password.

See also:
reenableKeyguard()
void gaia::service::KeyguardManager::dismissKeyguardOnNextActivity ( )

dismiss the keyguard.this method only works when the keyguard is not secure type and is showing.it is just for the dashboard to dismiss keyguard

void gaia::service::KeyguardManager::exitKeyguardSecurely ( )

Exit the keyguard securely.

The use case for this api is that, after disabling the keyguard, your app, which was granted permission to disable the keyguard and show a limited amount of information deemed safe without the user getting past the keyguard, needs to navigate to something that is not safe to view without getting past the keyguard.

This will, if the keyguard is secure, bring up the unlock screen of the keyguard.

bool gaia::service::KeyguardManager::isLocked ( ) const

return whether the screen is locked

bool gaia::service::KeyguardManager::isSecure ( ) const

return whether the screen requires a password to unlock

bool gaia::service::KeyguardManager::isShowing ( ) const

return whether the screen is showing

void gaia::service::KeyguardManager::reenableKeyguard ( )

Reenable the keyguard.

The keyguard will reappear if the previous call to disableKeyguard() caused it it to be hidden.

A good place to call this is from android.app.Activity#onPause()

Note: This call has no effect while any android.app.admin.DevicePolicyManager is enabled that requires a password.

See also:
disableKeyguard()
